data.event: The county was officially organized on March 10, 1859, and is named after Zimri A. Carter, a pioneer settler who came to Missouri from South Carolina in 1812.

event.title: came to Missouri from South Carolina in 1812

data.event: The county was officially organized on March 10, 1859, and is named after Zimri A. Carter, a pioneer settler who came to Missouri from South Carolina in 1812.
When the Missouri legislature created Carter County on March 10, 1859, it named the county after Zimri A. Carter.

event.title: 1807, at the age of 13, he came

data.event: In 1807, at the age of 13, he came to Missouri with his parents.
The Carter family initially settled in what is now Warren County.

(Various sources give dates as early as 1812 and as late as 1820 for Zimri Carter’s arrival in the area.) Zimri Carter became one of the most influential and respected men in southeast Missouri and was instrumental in bringing about the creation of Carter County and served for a time as county judge of Carter County.
